content.user_title: Create exploration content for SHINOBI WAY game
content.value_statement: Game designers need systematic ways to create regions, locations, and rooms for roguelike exploration games. This skill provides complete templates, type definitions, and validation checklists for building the Region‚ÜíLocation‚ÜíRoom hierarchy with intel-gated path choices.
actual_capabilities: Create region definitions with entry points, boss locations, and loot themes
Design locations with 10 rooms, danger levels, and terrain effects
Configure intel missions with elite enemies and path rewards
Build path networks with forward, branch, loop, and secret paths
Apply activity weights for combat, events, merchants, and rest rooms
Validate region designs using provided checklists
limitations: Does not generate executable game code - only provides design templates
Does not integrate with game engine - requires manual implementation
Does not modify project files - outputs TypeScript definitions for reference
Focused specifically on SHINOBI WAY game mechanics, not generic solutions

use_cases.title: Design new game regions
use_cases.description: Create themed regions with locations, paths, and elite encounters using the 1‚Üí2‚Üí4‚Üí2‚Üí1 room structure.

use_cases.title: Implement exploration mechanics
use_cases.description: Use TypeScript interface definitions to build navigation, intel collection, and path selection systems.

use_cases.title: Add new locations and paths
use_cases.description: Extend existing regions with secret locations, loop paths, and varied room activities.

prompt_templates.title: Create new region
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new region for SHINOBI WAY with 10-15 locations. Include entry points, boss location, loot theme, and example locations following the column progression (Entry‚ÜíEarly‚ÜíMid‚ÜíLate‚ÜíBoss).

prompt_templates.title: Design location
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a location with 10 rooms, danger level 1-7, terrain effects, and an intel mission. Include enemy pool, activity weights, and path connections.

prompt_templates.title: Configure intel mission
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an intel mission for Room 10 with an elite enemy, flavor text, skip allowed setting, and path rewards including hints for loops and secrets.

prompt_templates.title: Build path network
prompt_templates.prompt: Design the path network for a region including forward paths, branch routes, loop paths back to earlier locations, and secret paths with unlock conditions.

output_examples.input: Create a forest region with 12 locations including a hidden shrine and multiple paths to the boss
output: Region definition with id, name, theme, description, entryPoints, and bossLocation
12 locations arranged in 5 columns with appropriate danger levels (1-7)
Forest terrain with evasion bonuses and secret discovery effects
Intel missions for each location with elite enemies matching location type
Path network with forward paths, loops, and secret shrine unlock
Validation checklist confirming all locations reachable and boss accessible

best_practices: Follow the column layout (Entry‚ÜíEarly‚ÜíMid‚ÜíLate‚ÜíBoss) for consistent difficulty progression
Include at least 2-3 paths leading to the boss for player choice
Design secret locations with clear unlock conditions (intel, item, karma, story_flag)
Balance activity weights so each location has varied encounters
anti_patterns: Creating unreachable orphan locations that cannot be accessed from entry
Setting skipAllowed: true for boss location intel missions
Exceeding 15 locations per region or having fewer than 10
Forgetting to reset room activities when players use loop paths

faq.question: What game engines work with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill provides design templates and TypeScript interfaces compatible with React+TypeScript game projects like SHINOBI WAY.

faq.question: How many locations should a region contain?
faq.answer: Regions should contain 10-15 locations arranged in 5 columns with difficulty ranging from 1 (entry) to 7 (boss).

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing game code?
faq.answer: Yes. The TypeScript interface definitions in references/types.md can be copied directly into your game project.

faq.question: Is user data accessed during skill execution?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads its own documentation files and generates text output. No file writes or data collection occurs.

faq.question: Why does Room 10 always contain an intel mission?
faq.answer: The intel mission is the climax of each location. Players choose to fight for path information or skip to a random destination, creating strategic depth.

faq.question: How does this differ from generic game design tools?
faq.answer: This skill is specifically designed for SHINOBI WAY's roguelike exploration system with its unique Region‚ÜíLocation‚ÜíRoom hierarchy and intel-gated navigation.
